amendment.description: Amendment in the nature of a substitute sought to require a balanced Federal budget by fiscal year 2002, but would have exempted Social Security from budget calculations; and would have required a constitutional majority vote (218) to deficit spend.
amendment.purpose: An amendment in the nature of a substitute to require a balanced federal budget by Fiscal Year 2002, but would take Social Security off-budget. The amendment would require a constitutional majority (218) to raise the debt limit and contains no requirement for a supermajority to increase taxes, or to waive the balanced budget requirement in case of war or military threat. (The text of the amendment was printed in the Congressional Record on January 20, 1995 as amendment No. 29.).

action.text: Amendment (A005) in the nature of a substitute offered by Mr. Bonior.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Bonior amendment (A005) Failed by recorded vote: 135 - 296 (Roll no. 48).
